Resolved Question Show me another » How much can I make in a month on minimum wage? I am working at a sort of fast food restaurant, and I ma making minimum wage ($7.25/hour) and I usually work 7 hours a day, 5 days a week. I was wondering how much I could make in a month? I want to double check my math, and the max taxes I've seen taken out of my check are $3-4. Me and my bf (and his brother&gf) are going to move into an apartment and I would like to make enough money to be able to help out with the necessities and still make the rent. 3 years ago Report Abuse
Additional Details Well it is possible that I am getting paid under the table but I am unsure. The last time I got paid the taxes where seriously only like 4 dollars and there are no state tax taken out. And I have no payments. No car and no phone. And yes, we already have the bills and utilities split and everyone is on the lease. 3 years ago by spalmer Member since: May 19, 2009 Total points: 51,386 (Level 7) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters The taxes are wrong... more should be withheld from your paycheck. I assume that you claim 0 or 1 as a single individual.
Do you ever get overtime? If so, you could make as much as the company would allow. If not, at 40 hours per week, the most you could gross would be $1,160/month. With proper taxes taken out, you'd take home between $900 and $980/month. Plus, you have to be prepared if they drop you down to 10 or 20 hours a week (happens a lot in fast food). That would bring you down to only bringing home between $150-$350/month. Divided by four people, rent and utilities shouldn't be bad. Make sure you know who's going to put which utilities in their names. You'll want everyone to be on the lease, and you'll want a contract listing which items are divided by four. Of course, you know what other expenses you have... do you have to pay a car payment, car insurance, cell phone, etc?
Good luck! 3 years ago Report Abuse 100% 1 Vote 1 person rated this as good
